intro: Sisyrinchium firmifolium, commonly known as the firm-leaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, three-lobed leaves and has a compact growth habit. Sisyrinchium firmifolium is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
